column4: please paste the *exact* text of the error message to http://ubuntu.pastebin.com
it's very strange. ls and ld are two completely different applications. g++ uses ld, not ls. So I don't understand why your error messages talk about "ls"...
do you have any aliases e.g. have you defined ld as something? Type: alias to see...
yes, and guess which program does the linking: ld
run with -v to see what the compiler is doing...
no, build-id is a legitimate ld option. Which os version is this?
4.4.1 is quite old. Do you want to upgrade the compiler?
really? aptitude shows everything is updated though....
do you think I hit a bug?
it seems odd that you would be the first person to see this. Consider reinstalling the compilers?
it is weird isn't it? how can I force a reinstall?
Try sudo apt-get install --reinstall gcc g++
you need more expert help than I can provide. Consider asking on #gcc
you need to compare your systems gcc -v output with someone else running 9.10...
